text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Yamagishi was born in Saitama Prefecture on November 28, 1979. After graduating from Saitama Sakae High School, she joined Prima Ham FC Kunoichi (later Iga FC Kunoichi) in 1998. She played 131 matches in Nadeshiko League and she was selected Best Eleven 5 times (1999, 2001, 2002, 2003 and 2004). In 2007, she moved to INAC Leonessa. She retired end of 2008 season. In December 1998, when Yamagishi was 19 years old, she was selected the Japan national team for 1998 Asian Games. At this competition, on December 8, she debuted against Thailand. She played at 1999, 2001, 2003 AFC Championship and 2002 Asian Games. She was also a member of Japan for 2003 World Cup and 2004 Summer Olympics. She played 60 games and scored 6 goals for Japan until 2005. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1998 4 1 1999 5 3 2000 5 1 2001 11 0 2002 11 0 2003 12 1 2004 10 0 2005 2 0 Total 60 6 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Saitama Prefecture Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:INAC Kobe Leonessa players Category:Footballers at the 2004 Summer Olympics Category:2003 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1999 AFC Women's Championship players Category:2001 AFC Women's Championship players Category:2003 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1998 Asian Games Category:Footballers at the 2002 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games bronze medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1998 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 2002 Asian Games
title: Yasuyo Yamagishi
